headline: McDonald’s Stock Has Slipped. One Analyst Sees 21% Upside.
summary: McDonald’s  stock has seen a 10% pullback since May 19, but UBS analyst Dennis Geiger remains upbeat about the shares in a Friday note.  Shares of the hamburger chain are up 1.3% in Friday trading while the  is up 0.7%.  Despite sluggish fast-food sales this year and pressured low-income consumers, Geiger believes McDonald’s should see improving sales trends in the second half of the year in both the U.S. and international markets.
